intro: Scilla otschiauriae, commonly known as the Armenian scilla, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous root system. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped blue or violet flowers during the spring season. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
